item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, September 27, 2024 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. It's hard to write code for computers, but it's harder to write code for humans (129 points | 41 comments)
2. I've built a city, now it needs residents (56 points | 36 comments)
3. Money-Laundering Practices in the Online Scam Industry (24 points | 3 comments)
4. Everything we know about spies is wrong (19 points | 9 comments)
5. The CRPG Book Project (15 points | 2 comments)
6. Legalizing Sports Gambling Was a Mistake (693 points | 617 comments)
7. Raft: Understandable Distributed Consensus (9 points | 2 comments)
8. Collaborative Text Editing with e.g.-Walker: Better, Faster, Smaller (9 points | discuss)
9. TSMC execs allegedly dismissed OpenAI CEO Sam Altman as 'podcasting bro' (306 points | 279 comments)
10. CNN and USA Today Have Fake Websites, I Believe Forbes Marketplace Runs Them (3 points | discuss)
11. CouchDB 3.4.1 Released (54 points | 28 comments)
12. MTA Open Data Challenge (3 points | discuss)
13. OpenAI is closing in on raising $6.5B. Largest VC raise in history (32 points | 18 comments)
14. I Am Tired of AI (525 points | 516 comments)
15. End of an era: Landsat 7 mission takes final images (238 points | 44 comments)
16. Our container platform is in production. It has GPUs. Here's an early look (22 points | discuss)
17. HP injects AI into its printers (27 points | 25 comments)
18. Japan's humble onigiri took over lunchtimes around the world (12 points | discuss)
19. I have 2000 old VHS tapes in my garage and don't know what to do with them (276 points | 249 comments)
20. Imbue (YC S17) Is Hiring a Founding Product Engineer ( | hide)
21. Hacking Kia: Remotely controlling cars with just a license plate (522 points | 310 comments)
22. LlamaF: An Efficient Llama2 Architecture Accelerator on Embedded FPGAs (4 points | discuss)
23. Two kinds of LLM responses: Informational vs. Instructional (49 points | 7 comments)
24. Agitating Homemade PCBs with Ease (3 points | discuss)
25. Vanilla OS 2: an immutable distribution to run all software (141 points | 40 comments)
26. Small3dlib: Suckless PD 3D software rasterizer (209 points | 87 comments)
27. A pilot project in universal algebra to explore new ways to collaborate (165 points | 22 comments)
28. Why are my ZFS disks so noisy? (130 points | 31 comments)
29. EU privacy regulator fines Meta 91M euros over password storage (19 points | discuss)
30. Maggie Smith, Star of 'Downton Abbey,' 'Harry Potter,' Dies at 89 (3 points | 1 comment)
